FREN 341 Traumatic Histories: Literature and Psychoanalysis 
Claire Nouvet (MW 11:30-12:45 in person)
Content: As he studied hysteria, Freud discovered (through the elaboration of concepts such as the unconscious, repression, and trauma) that a past which has been repressed can return to disrupt the present.  While psychoanalysis focused initially on sexual traumas, it later addressed the issue of the transgenerational transmission of historical traumas. Why and  how do traumatic histories haunt the next generations? And what happens to those who incarnate past histories that the present prefers to forget?  These are some of the questions that we will address at the juncture of literature and psychoanalysis.
Texts
-	Freud:  Introductory Lectures [selections]
            Studies in Hysteria [selections]
            Delusion and Dream in Wilhelm Jensen's Gradiva
-	Balzac: Adieu 
-	Maupassant: The Horla
-	Apollinaire: Calligrammes: Poems of Peace and War
